ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn petʉ̀nzẅìŋ, áa yɛ̌ tá n gɔɔn né pi ngie, pi lɔgɔ gẅi lenéŋè ńnyɛ ngie pi kúʼte nò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tà á tʉ̀. N ne ńtsɔ́ɔn légíŋ ńgyá gẅí. Pi pie pi ee ssé ńgwɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn lekág, ńgwɔ́ yɔ̀ɔn ngǔʼ.
en: So then, my dearly loved and longed for brothers and sisters, my joy and crown,   in this manner stand firm  # 4:1 Rm 14:4; 1Co 16:13; Php 1:27; 2:2 in the Lord, dear friends.

ngiemboon: N sẅiŋté Evondi pɔ́ Sintishÿe ngie pɔ́ gwɔ́ tàʼ ncwò, á nue pɔ́ metsèm gwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a,
en: I urge Euodia and I urge Syntyche to agree in the Lord.

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńgʉa na gù, kwàʼ shǔ wɔ̀ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ fàʼ, n ne sẅíŋte gú ngie ɔ̀ kẅéte wɔ́b, ée panzwě pie peg lâ pɔ̌ né Kelemaŋ ka pǔ ńdÿɔ́ʼ ncù na nò nkʉ̀ mbòŋo. Peg laa tsɔ́ pʉ̀a la gíŋ ńgwɔ́, tà mezíŋ mɔ́b ée tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne legwɔ́ wó.
en: Yes, I also ask you, true partner,   to help these women who have contended for the gospel at my side, along with Clement and the rest of my coworkers whose names are in the book of life.

ngiemboon: N ge gɔɔn né pi ngie ntʉ́m gẅí néŋe ńkág kág, á nue pi ee pʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. N gɔ̌ɔn né pi ngie, ntʉ́m gẅí néŋe ńkág kág.
en: Rejoice in the Lord always. I will say it again: Rejoice!

ngiemboon: Pi gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie mé zsé ngie pi pʉ́le pʉlé. Pi kímte ngie entyě páʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge tó, é té sag.
en: Let your graciousness   be known to everyone. The Lord is near.  # 4:5 1Co 16:22; Php 1:6; Heb 10:24–25; Jms 5:8; Rv 1:7; 3:11; 22:20

ngiemboon: Tà pi púʼ mbùm gí na tsɔ́ nò. Táʼ, akɔ́ nò zɔ̌ lɔɔn ńtyé ssé wɔ́ɔ, pi púʼ mbwó mbwó Ssé, éshwóŋo yé mmó gie pi ne ńtsɔ́ɔn, ésẅíŋte yé, ḿbiŋ ńná ndǎg mbwó yé.
en: Don’t worry about anything, but in everything, through prayer and petition with thanksgiving, present your requests to God.

ngiemboon: Pi ge gÿo púʼu, e Ssé náa sẅétè gie nyìŋ mesoŋ te zsé páʼ á gwɔ́ wɔ́, né pi. Ayɛ̌ sẅétè pyɛ́bte mentʉ́m mí, mbɔɔ nkwaŋá gẅí, ńgÿo é tyé pɔ́ na Yěsô Keleto.
en: And the peace of God, which surpasses   all understanding, will guard your hearts and minds in Christ Jesus.  # 4:7 Rm 16:7; Eph 2:6; Php 1:1,15; 1Pt 5:14

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, anò gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n dɔg ńcʉ́me á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie, nkwaŋá gẅí néŋe ńtyé pɔ́ na menò mbòŋo mie pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gɔʼte, ńtyé na nò nénʉ́, á na nò gie á tyé ndʉŋndʉŋ, á na nò té lɔ̌ʼ, á na menò mie ée me mekùʼ, á na menò mie mé gÿo epʉ̀a ná ngɔ̀ɔnte, é menò mie é kẅéte, á na menò mie mé síŋte nyìŋ mǒ.
en: Finally   brothers and sisters, whatever is true,  # 4:8 Jn 8:14 whatever is honorable,  # 4:8 1Tm 3:8,11; Ti 2:2 whatever is just,  # 4:8 Rm 1:17 whatever is pure,  # 4:8 2Co 7:11; 11:2; 1Tm 5:22; Ti 2:5; Jms 3:17; 1Pt 3:2; 1Jn 3:3 whatever is lovely, whatever is commendable #— #if there is any moral excellence  # 4:8 1Pt 2:9; 2Pt 1:3,5 and if there is anything praiseworthy #— #dwell on these things.

ngiemboon: Akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie n ka zíʼi gẅí, akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie pi ka júʼu ncwò mèŋ, akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie pi ka gyǎ n gÿo, pi laʼte mé gyá. E Ssé gie ee Ssé mbʉ́lè, e gwɔ́ né pi.
en: Do what you have learned and received   and heard from me, and seen in me, and the God of peace will be with you.

ngiemboon: N ne ńnáa ndǎg mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ḿbiŋ ńne ńkága tɛʼ, mélàʼmie pi gíŋ ńgẅiin shÿó lényɛ ngie pi ne ńkímte wɔ́ɔn. Pi ka zɔɔn ńne ńkímte wɔ́ɔn kimté, tá ńzága mánzsè lélɔg ńkẅéte wɔ́ɔn.
en: I rejoiced in the Lord greatly because once again   you renewed your care for me.  # 4:10 2Co 8:1–2; 11:9 You were, in fact, concerned about me but lacked the opportunity to show it.

ngiemboon: N těen ńgɔɔn púʼu, mélàʼmie tsɔ́ mmó ne ńzága mbwó mèŋ wɔ́. N da zíʼi légwɔ́ gie n dɔɔn ńzága mmó lo, ńgẅiin lo, n ne ńkága kǎg.
en: I don’t say this out of need, for I have learned to be content in whatever circumstances I find myself.

ngiemboon: N déen ńzíʼi léshÿɔg nzyè, ńgíŋ ńzíʼi lénéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ fùʼ. N déen ńzíʼi légwɔ́ gie n dɔɔn ńtyé pɔ́ nzɔ̌ wɔ́ɔ, akɔ́ zɔ̌ gwɔ́ ssé wɔ́ɔ, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ léshÿɔg nzyè, mèŋ shÿɔg, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lépfɛ́ tà ńzẅɛ́ m pfɛ́, ńgwɔ́ gie á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ fʉ̀ʼʉ nzyè, kà fʉ̀ʼʉ shúm léjÿó wɔ́ɔ, ń de pɔ́gɔ tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: I know how to make do with little, and I know how to make do with a lot.   In any and all circumstances I have learned the secret of being content #— #whether well fed or hungry, whether in abundance or in need.

ngiemboon: Keleto zɔ náa wɔ́ɔn metʉ̀, tá n kuʼu légÿo púʼu.
en: I am able to do all things through him   who strengthens me.  # 4:13 2Co 12:9; Eph 3:16; Col 1:11; 1Tm 1:12; 2Tm 4:17

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ púʼu, pi ka gÿo mboŋó lékẅéte wɔ́ɔn na fʉ̀ʼɔɔn gie n gee tsɛ̀ɛ cʉanò lɔɔn.
en: Still, you did well by partnering with me in my hardship.

ngiemboon: Pi pà Filípò, pi ne ńzsé mboŋó ngie pi gíle pi zɔ la ké ńkẅéte wɔ́ɔn, á fʉ̀ʼ gie n da fó tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅí á Masenduwane ńgʉa, légwá ńgiŋ ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo. Á laa fʉ̀ʼ gie mé la nyé ńzye zye létsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo, atsɔ́ cúʼtè pʉ̀a Keleto yendyɛ̀ʼɛ la te zába pwó na fàʼ yɔ́ɔn, ńzsé mmó gie á ne ńzága wɔ́ɔn, ḿbiŋ ńzsé gie afàʼ yɔ́ɔn ne ńnáa wɔ́.
en: And you Philippians   know that in the early days of the gospel,  # 4:15 Ac 16:6–40; Php 1:5 when I left Macedonia,  # 4:15 Ac 16:9 no church shared with me in the matter of giving and receiving except you alone.

ngiemboon: N da gwɔ́ tà ńkúu Tesaloníkà, pi túm shúm sie é la ne ńzága mbwó mèŋ. Pi la túm ngʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: For even in Thessalonica   you sent gifts for my need  # 4:16 Mt 6:8 several times.

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn páʼɔɔn, á té gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie, n ne faʼa pɔ́ shúm sie mé ge túm ńná né mèŋ wɔ́. N ne ńtsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ ngie e Ssé fó mǒ ńnéŋ mbʉ́lè na pi.
en: Not that I seek the gift, but I seek the profit  ,# 4:17 Mt 3:8; Rm 1:13; Gl 5:22 that is increasing to your account.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na shúm sie pi ka tǔm ńná né mèŋ, mbà m bǔ ńgyá. N gẅiin shúm fʉ̀ʼɔɔn tà é gyɔ́ɔn tɛʼ. N gyǎ shúm ŋwɛ́ sie Epafolondid lɔ̌g ńtó. N te gíŋ ńne ńzága tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́. Eshúm ŋwɛ́ poŋó wɔ́ɔn tɛʼ, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ shúm pwɔʼ sie mé lɔ́ɔn ńnuŋe mvfò Ssé, é poŋo yé tɛʼ la.
en: But I have received everything in full,   and I have an abundance. I am fully supplied,  # 4:18 Or Here, then, is my receipt for everything, I have an abundance, for I am fully supplied having received from Epaphroditus  # 4:18 Php 2:25 what you provided #— #a fragrant offering, an acceptable sacrifice, pleasing  # 4:18 Heb 13:21 to God.

ngiemboon: E Ssé yɔ̀ɔn ge lɔg ntí gie aa ńgẅiin shúm púʼu, é cʉa na Yěsô Keleto, é náa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á ne ńzága mbwó pi té sáŋ.
en: And my God   will supply all your needs according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus.

ngiemboon: Agùʼte gwɔ́ mbwó Tá wege Ssé, á na mengùʼu mengùʼ. Amɛn.
en: Now to our God and Father   be glory forever and ever.  # 4:20 Gl 1:5; 1Tm 1:17; 2Tm 4:18; Heb 13:21 Amen.  # 4:20 Rm 11:36; Rv 22:21

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛʼte pʉ̀a metsèm pie é la zẅɛ́ʼɛ Yěsô Keleto ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a Ssé. Mefɛ̌ mefɛ̌ pie peg lâ pɔ̌ ee jʉʼɔɔn, é tsyɛʼté gẅí yɔ́b.
en: Greet every saint in Christ Jesus. The brothers who are with me send you greetings.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Keleto metsèm tsyɛʼté gẅí, n gɔɔn páʼɔɔn té lege tsyɛ̀ʼte ye pʉ̀a Keleto pie ée nɔʼɔ Kásà.
en: All the saints send you greetings, especially those who belong to Caesar’s   household.  # 4:22 Php 1:7

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Keleto, lɔgɔ legwɔ́ ntʉ́m pi, ńcÿó gʉm gí.
en: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.  ,# 4:23 Rm 1:9
